messages.text:
Heya <@U027201FQSV> <@U8F7ZDAPM> <@U7SJ525DE>

You might have seen a ping on this <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C087X11S06A/p1752221071377359|channel> from Consumer Core but tldr; they are looking to deprecate the use of `PATCH /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}` for editting delivery information as they rollout CDPS. Is this work we already have on our roadmaps as we adopt CDPS?

If not, we ideally have to prioritize it in the next 2 sprints. Technically they asked for this to be done by end of July but IMO this is unrealistic. I have aligned on a mid Aug deadline instead but want to confirm that we can make this change for our TPT and GoC brands before then. The change itself looks pretty straightforward to me

attachments.fallback:
[July 11th, 2025 1:04 AM] damian.tylczynski: :memo: *"PATCH /subscription" for Delivery updates End of Life*

Dear Deliveries clients (*web, mobile & internal backend* services),

As a part of Consumer Core strategy and *Alliance KR* we are in process of moving the source of truth of Deliveries information from Intfood to CDPS; introducing a *new Deliveries API* and taking over all the APIv2 endpoints that modify Delivery information.

To be able to achieve that we ask all the clients that are using “*PATCH /subscription*” (mixing concern of many entities) for the purpose of changing delivery information to simply switch to existing APIv2 “*POST /plans/{id}/changePlanDeliveryDetails*” endpoint. This is the only way we can guarantee that the use-cases will be successfully supported after switching the source of truth to the new system. All the API calls that are being done to “*PATCH /subscription*” will stop to update the Delivery entities.

:hourglass_flowing_sand: *Due Date:* 31 July.

We see following clients (cc among others <@UEZ4PRFKM> <@U06L36ATUCD> <@U0708FBKN30>) updating the delivery option/interval using this endpoint:
• Android app
• iPhone app
• GreenChef Mobile App (Android)
• whitelabel-mobile/Everyplate
• whitelable-mobile/Youfoodz
• Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-window
• Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-address
• Web: /my-account/deliveries/menu
• Web: /settings/plan/delivery-address
• Web: /settings/plan/reactivate
• Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-interval
We have prepared <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DPLAT/pages/5490737211/PATCH+subscription+for+Delivery+updates+End+of+Life|description of the change requested> and *we would like to know back from you* in the :thread: the feasibility of such change in your client.
attachments.text:
:memo: *"PATCH /subscription" for Delivery updates End of Life*

Dear Deliveries clients (*web, mobile & internal backend* services),

As a part of Consumer Core strategy and *Alliance KR* we are in process of moving the source of truth of Deliveries information from Intfood to CDPS; introducing a *new Deliveries API* and taking over all the APIv2 endpoints that modify Delivery information.

To be able to achieve that we ask all the clients that are using “*PATCH /subscription*” (mixing concern of many entities) for the purpose of changing delivery information to simply switch to existing APIv2 “*POST /plans/{id}/changePlanDeliveryDetails*” endpoint. This is the only way we can guarantee that the use-cases will be successfully supported after switching the source of truth to the new system. All the API calls that are being done to “*PATCH /subscription*” will stop to update the Delivery entities.

:hourglass_flowing_sand: *Due Date:* 31 July.

We see following clients (cc among others <@UEZ4PRFKM> <@U06L36ATUCD> <@U0708FBKN30>) updating the delivery option/interval using this endpoint:
• Android app
• iPhone app
• GreenChef Mobile App (Android)
• whitelabel-mobile/Everyplate
• whitelable-mobile/Youfoodz
• Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-window
• Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-address
• Web: /my-account/deliveries/menu
• Web: /settings/plan/delivery-address
• Web: /settings/plan/reactivate
• Web: /account-settings/subscription-settings/delivery-interval
We have prepared <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DPLAT/pages/5490737211/PATCH+subscription+for+Delivery+updates+End+of+Life|description of the change requested> and *we would like to know back from you* in the :thread: the feasibility of such change in your client.

<@U01TLRS1W9L>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Removal of /calculate/batch API in price-service`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `Hi, we are going to deprecate /calculate/batch API in price-service soon. The last major sources of requests to this API were GoodChop and ThePetsTable. Last week, the GoodChop team made the changes and they no longer call the API. Now I see ThePetsTable is #1 caller of the API. Can you check what are the use-cases to call /calculate/batch in price-service? Can we disable the API without negative consequences on the user-experience?`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question
attachments.text:

_thread_replies.text:
I have created <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3035|a ticket> to handle migration for GoC.

We were able to find two cases, when we call `PATCH /subscriptions/{id}` API endpoint:
1. Delivery Information change on the `/settings/plan`
2. Reactivation on the `/settings/plan/reactivate`
I guess the first place is common between GoC and TPT.

attachments.fallback:
[July 10th, 2025 5:07 AM] elio.duarte: :mega: *We will move staging domains to Vercel* :mega:

We will start using Vercel for our staging websites, such as <https://www-staging.hellofresh.com>, on *14.07.2025*. We use Vercel for our production environment, and we want our staging environment to be as similar to it as possible.

*Why It Matters*: To access the staging sites, you will need to be part of the *acl_vercel_viewer* group in Azure and logged on Vercel. <https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/docs/vercel.md#prerequisites|Here are the detailed instructions> on how to do this.

Please share any questions or concerns in the <#C0125D6G44U|> channel.
attachments.text:
:mega: *We will move staging domains to Vercel* :mega:

We will start using Vercel for our staging websites, such as <https://www-staging.hellofresh.com>, on *14.07.2025*. We use Vercel for our production environment, and we want our staging environment to be as similar to it as possible.

*Why It Matters*: To access the staging sites, you will need to be part of the *acl_vercel_viewer* group in Azure and logged on Vercel. <https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/docs/vercel.md#prerequisites|Here are the detailed instructions> on how to do this.

Please share any questions or concerns in the <#C0125D6G44U|> channel.
